metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10504 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability in the opj_mqc_byteout function in mqc.c in OpenJPEG before 2.2.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted bmp file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10504` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.2.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.2.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.2.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-1').
